Job Posting:173183 - Position: W26 Junior Software Engineer Co-op (Platform Team) 173183 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/19/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 09/12/2025 10:31 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Trulioo Information Services Inc. #1200 1055 W Hastings Vancouver V6E 2E9 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Junior Software Engineer Co-op (Platform Team) 173183 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 8 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 40 Major List $22 - $25/hour Work Arrangements: Start & End Date of Work Term: Jan 13, 2026 - August 21, 2026 • • Duration: 8 months • Hourly Pay Rate: $22/hour for Bachelor's degree, and $25/hour for Master's degree students plus 4% vacation pay • Full-time: 40 hour work week • Perks: 4 days paid sick day allowance, office lunches, happy hours and other social events! • Hybrid Model: Working at least 3 days per week from our Mount Pleasant office, located at 114 E 4th Ave #400, Vancouver, BC V5T 1G2 All interviews will be conducted virtually via Zoom video call. Are you ready to embark on a career that truly affects people around the world? Trulioo invites you to be a catalyst for change in the dynamic realm of digital identity verification. As the global front-runner in our industry, we are redefining how businesses grow, innovate and comply online. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, contributing to our award-winning platform that enables organizations worldwide to quickly onboard customers, optimize costs and combat fraud. Fueled by Silicon Valley support, Trulioo stands as the trusted platform that can verify more than 5 billion people and 700 million business entities spanning 195 countries. But Trulioo is more than a tech company. We are a united force of dedicated experts committed to establishing trust online. Headquartered in Vancouver and with strategic hubs in San Diego and Dublin, we foster a culture of collaboration and open communication. Our offices support a hybrid model and staff typically work three days per week at a hub location. Join us where excitement meets innovation and contribute to a world where trust and technology unite. Position Summary: To continue to fuel our growth, we are seeking a Junior Software Engineer Co-op to join as a key contributor to our platform engineering team. Trulioo's platform engineering team is responsible for developing a distributed cloud platform that supports production API services, big data infrastructure, and processes machine learning. You will be responsible for the platform that is used to verify 5 billion people and help us become the most developer-friendly fintech company in the world. This is an 8-month, fixed-term position based out of our Mount Pleasant office in Vancouver, following a hybrid work model with three in-office days per week. What you'll be doing: • Learn and apply modern cloud technologies under guidance from senior engineers. • Contribute to development of features and fixes in collaboration with the engineering team. • Assist with writing unit tests and supporting QA to ensure features meet requirements. • Help maintain and update technical documentation. • Participate in code reviews to learn best practices and contribute feedback. Troubleshoot and debug issues with support from team members. • Thriving at Trulioo At Trulioo, you're not just an employee. You're a valued member of our Trulicrew on a journey of professional and personal growth with a world-class organization. With Trulioo, you have the power to revolutionize the intersection of technology, digital trust and online identity to open the global economy to everyone. Together, we can shape the digital future. We're on the lookout for exceptional people to empower with trust, autonomy and the freedom to cultivate their potential. Your curiosity, meticulous attention to detail and passion to contribute are highly valued. If that resonates with you, apply today to become a part of our team. Join us in shaping a future where your career isn't just a journey but also a boundless exploration into the possibilities of technology and digital identity verification. If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that minorities and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply. Trulioo welcomes applications from people with disabilities. Support is available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Finally, we know from time-to-time emergencies happen and you may need to reschedule an interview - we understand and encourage you to be in communication without worrying about losing the opportunity or your credibility. Privacy Notice As part of our job application process, Trulioo collects, processes, and discloses personal data for the purpose of identifying suitable candidates for our job openings. For more detail, please visit Trulioo's Website Privacy Policy in the section "When you apply for a job". Job Requirements Important Requirements: You must be pursuing a Diploma, Undergraduate or Graduate degree. • • You must be enrolled at an accredited university in British Columbia. • Participation in your university's co-op program is a must. • Must include an unofficial transcript with your resume. • Complete all necessary requirements set forth by your educational institution, including application processes and associated fees. • For international students, possession of a valid Co-op work permit from Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) is mandatory. You have: • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering or related field. • Familiarity with developing distributed cloud applications and Web/API services using C#, Python, or other programming languages. • Exposure to AWS, Serverless, Microservice architectures, and other modern application paradigms. • Basic understanding of both relational databases (SQL) and non-relational databases (NoSQL). • Ability to write efficient queries to manipulate and retrieve data from databases. Familiarity with concepts such as joins and indexing • Ability to write unit tests and testing strategies • Knowledge of network protocols. Strong problem-solving mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies quickly. • It's a bonus if you have... • Hands-on experience with .Net, .Net Core, backend processing, and big data platform. • Hands-on experience with AWS. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/coops&interns/jobs/5648631004 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
